content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined above. Which of the following conditions explains why <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is not continuous at <math alttext="x equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Neither <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> nor <math alttext="f of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> exists.

<math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> exists, but <math alttext="f of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.

Both <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> exist, but <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x, is not equal to, f of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≠</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Both <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="f of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> exist, and <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x, equals, f of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 2, of, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> exists, but <math alttext="f of 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> does not exist.
